newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore PCS to restart No. 1 plant over weekend.
newsitem.headline: Singapore PCS to restart No. 1 plant over weekend.

text.p: The Petrochemical Corporation of Singapore (PCS) plans to restart its number one ethylene plant over the weekened, a company offical said on Friday.
"The authority has given approval to start up the plant," the official said. "We are now preparing to start it up over the weekend."

The 450,000-tonne-per-year plant was shut down on Monday for government officials to carry out investigations following the death of two divers while clearing debris at the unit's seawater intake pit.
PCS is a 50:50 joint venture between Royal Dutch Shell and a Sumitomo Chemical led consortium of Japanese companies.
The company in April started up a new 515,000-tonne-per-year ethylene plant as part of a Singapore $3.4 billion expansion to the first complex.
